data.segment: 5/1/24, 11:06 AM Enigma Stealer Targets Cryptocurrency Industry with Fake Jobs | Trend Micro (NO) Malware Enigma Stealer Targets Cryptocurrency Industry with Fake Jobs We discovered an active campaign targeting Eastern Europeans in the cryptocurrency industry using fake job lures. By: Aliakbar Zahravi, Peter Girnus February 09, 2023 Read time: 11 min (3099 words) P ri n t   Subscribe We recently found an active campaign that uses a fake employment pretext targeting Eastern Europeans in the cryptocurrency industry to install an information stealer. In this campaign, the suspected Russian threat actors use several highly obfuscated and under-development custom loaders to infect those involved in the cryptocurrency industry with the Enigma Stealer (detected as TrojanSpy.MSIL.ENIGMASTEALER.YXDBC), a modi�ed version of the Stealerium information stealer. In addition to these loaders, the attacker also exploits CVE-2015-2291, an Intel driver vulnerability, to load a malicious driver designed to reduce the token integrity of Microsoft Defender.  Cookies Settings This website uses cookies for website functionality, tra�c analytics, personalization, social media functionality and Steadavleerrtiisuinmg., O tuhre C ooorkiigei nNoatli cien pfororvmideast imoonr es itnefoarlmeart iwonh aicnhd serves as the base for Accept explains how to amend your cookie settings. Through the use of employment lures, these actors can target individuals and organizations across the cryptocurrency and Web 3 sphere. Furthermore, this case highlights the evolving nature of modular malware that employ highly obfuscated and evasive techniques along with the utilization of continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) principles for continuous  malware development.
